full.string: App Users in this Project only will be able to download and use Forms within this Project. When you create a new App User, it will not have access to any Forms at first. To set the Forms each App User may access, use the {formAccess} tab. Multiple devices can use the same App User profile without problem. For more information, {clickHere}.

The following are separate strings that will be translated below. They will be formatted within ODK Central, for example, they might be bold or a link.

- {formAccess} has the text: Form Access
- {clickHere} has the text: click here

This text will be formatted within ODK Central, for example, it might be bold or a link. It will be inserted where {formAccess} is in the following text:

update.developer_comment: This is the text for an action, for example, the text of a button.

0.string: If you enable encryption, the following things will happen:

1.string: Finalized Submission data will be encrypted on mobile devices.

2.string: Submission data at rest will be encrypted on the Central server.

0.string: Forms configured with manual {submission} keys will continue to use those keys, and must be manually decrypted.
0.developer_comment: {submission} will have the text "<submission>", which is XML and will not be translated.

1.string: To use the automatic Central encryption process on these Forms, remove the {base64RsaPublicKey} configuration.
1.developer_comment: {base64RsaPublicKey} will have the text "base64RsaPublicKey", which is code and will not be translated.

4.string: You will no longer be able to preview Submission data online.

5.string: You will no longer be able to connect to data over OData.

0.string: In addition, the following are true in this version of ODK Central:
Existing Submissions will remain unencrypted.

1.string: In a future version, you will have the option to encrypt existing data.

0.string: Encryption cannot be turned off once enabled.

1.string: In a future version, you will be able to disable encryption, which will decrypt your data. This will be true even if you enable encryption now.

full.string: You can learn more about encryption {here}. If this sounds like something you want, press Next to proceed.
full.developer_comment:
{here} is a separate string that will be translated below. Its text will be formatted within ODK Central, for example, it might be bold or a link. Its text is:

here

here.developer_comment:
This text will be formatted within ODK Central, for example, it might be bold or a link. It will be inserted where {here} is in the following text:

You can learn more about encryption {here}. If this sounds like something you want, press Next to proceed.

0.string: First, you will need to choose a passphrase. This passphrase will be required to decrypt your Submissions. For your privacy, the server will not remember this passphrase: only people with the passphrase will be able to decrypt and read your Submission data.

full.string: There are no length or content restrictions on the passphrase, but if you lose it, there is {no} way to recover it or your data!
full.developer_comment:
{no} is a separate string that will be translated below. Its text will be formatted within ODK Central, for example, it might be bold or a link. Its text is:

no

no.developer_comment:
This text will be formatted within ODK Central, for example, it might be bold or a link. It will be inserted where {no} is in the following text:

There are no length or content restrictions on the passphrase, but if you lose it, there is {no} way to recover it or your data!

introduction.string: Encryption has been configured for this Project. Any mobile devices will have to fetch or refetch the latest Forms for encryption to take place.

0.string: Any Forms you create in this Project will only be visible on data collection devices to App Users who are a part of this Project.

1.string: Future releases of ODK Central will add more Project-centric features, including improvements to Form states and workflow, device state updates, Collect settings management, and more granular permissioning.

0.string: Web Users have accounts on this website to oversee and administer the Projects on this server. Administrators can manage anything on the site. Users with no role can still be made Project Managers on any Project, from that Project’s settings.
